alert.note: Alert for Barnes; Benson; Cass; Cavalier; Eastern Walsh County; Eddy; Grand Forks; Griggs; Nelson; Pembina; Ramsey; Ransom; Richland; Sargent; Steele; Towner; Traill; Western Walsh County (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 10 at 6:22AM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...PERIODS OF SIGNIFICANT WINTER TRAVEL IMPACTS POSSIBLE LATE THIS AFTERNOON INTO FRIDAY... A clipper and associated strong cold front move into eastern ND and northwest MN later today through Friday, bringing several periods of possible winter travel impacts. Snow squalls may develop along the front after 4 PM in the Devils Lake Basin and spread east over the Red River Valley through the evening commute. These type of convective snow systems can result in a sudden brief periods of intense snowfall and whiteout conditions as winds gust as high as 45 mph. After this initial period of snow and strong winds, there may be a slight decrease in winds and impacts. Isolated to scattered snow showers may continue into Friday, and where snow showers track brief whiteout conditions will remain possible. Winds then increase once again Friday morning and may lead to additional blowing snow impacts mainly north of Highway 200 in the open country of the Red River Valley. The older snow pack is unlikely to respond to the periods of windy conditions, however where snow showers or freshly fallen snow of 1 inch or more occurs blizzard conditions may develop. This is hard to anticipate at this time and conditions may be highly variable by location and duration. At this time there is a 30 percent chance for blizzard conditions along and west of the Red River Valley this evening. There is a 40 percent chance for blizzard conditions north of Highway 200 in the Red River Valley starting again Friday morning.
